help.text-prev:
Click BUILD PANELS to create panels from the raw files.
Then Save All to download all panels as JSON and place them in public/source_panels.
institutions.json goes in /src/assets/
They will automatically be added to the existing panels.
help.text:
Click BUILD PANELS to create panels from the raw files.
Then Save All to download all panels as JSON and place them in public/source_panels.

new.tooltip: Add a Panel to the List

saveAll.tooltip: Download a JSON file of the panels

noInstitution.text: Select Institution in the Institutions tab after saving

validation.csv-file-not-valid: CSV File is Not valid. Please upload valid file
validation.bed-file-not-valid: BED File is Not valid. Please upload valid file

info.part1: All changes are temporary. They will be lost after reload.
info.part2: Replace assets/panels.json on your server to make the changes permanent for all users.

buildPanels.tooltip: Parse CSV Files to JSON Gene Panels

repo.tooltip: Open Github in a new tab

cannotSaveOnePanel.tooltip: Cannot Save if Contains Not Found or Synonyms

saveWarning.tooltip: GTI will skip 'Not Found' and replace Synonyms

text.part1: The page you are trying to reach does not exist.

result.text: Merge this theme in vuetify.ts (under light or dark)

explain.text: For deeper changes to the default logo and app title, modify images in /src/assets/gti/ and /public/favicon.ico

validation.list-empty: Gene List must not be empty
validation.list-min-characters: Gene List must be at least 2 characters

empty.text: The last 3 searches will be displayed here

symbols.tooltip: Symbols: It's an exact match to a gene symbol.

synonyms.tooltip: Synonyms: You submitted a synonym. GTI found a corresponding gene symbol.
synonyms.details:
GTI will use the corresponding symbol instead of the synonym.
Use a valid symbol if the default replacement does not match.

notFound.tooltip: Not Found: It could be a typo or a non-standard gene.

empty.text: Nothing yet. Type some genes above first.

new.tooltip: Add an Institution to the List

saveAll.tooltip: Download a JSON file of the institutions

info.part1: All changes are temporary. They will be lost after reload.
info.part2: Replace assets/institutions.json on your server to make the changes permanent for all users.

parsedInput.part1b: entries are compared to known genes.

geneSearch.part1b: to find which panels contain those genes.
geneSearch.part2a: If some genes submitted are not valid genes,

panelResults.part2a: Click on a cell to get more information about each value

panelCompare.part1a: shows each Symbol and Synonym from
panelCompare.part1b: and which panel has those genes.
panelCompare.part2: A gene (each row in leftmost column) may match a gene symbol or a synonym in each panel (column)

part3.noMatch: does not have a Symbol (or Synonym) for the

database.purpose: To know if a search is using symbols or synonyms, GTI uses a gene_info file from NCBI.

howTo.part1: To use the latest gene_info, download the file (step 1) and open it in the app (step2).
howTo.part2: Replace the downloaded files on your server (step 3)

panelExplore.purpose: Click on a gene panel below to see the genes it contains and to download its source file (.bed or .csv)
panelExplore.edit: Here you can edit or delete existing panels and create new ones by importing a .bed or .csv file.

institutionExplore.purpose: Click on an institution below to see its contact information
institutionExplore.edit: Here you can edit or delete existing institutions and create new ones.

fileFormats.part1: GTI accepts two file formats to import new panels: .csv and .bed.
fileFormats.part2: When parsing a file, GTI only uses the gene name, it could be a symbol or a synonym.
fileFormats.part3: If it cannot find a matching term, the gene is considered 'Not Found' and ignored during searches.

csv.part1: It's a simple text file: one column with a list of genes.
csv.part2: The first row needs to be the column header (the label doesn't matter). Other columns are ignored.

bed.part1: Bed files have at least 4 columns, separated by tabs (no header):
bed.part2: At the moment, only the NAME column is parsed. The gene name is extracted by taking the first term before

genelink.tooltip: Open Link to NCBI Gene Database

geneinfoSource.tooltip: Download gene_info file from NCBI Gene Database

symbols.tooltip: Symbols: The panel contains an exact match to a gene symbol.

synonyms.tooltip: Synonyms: The panel contains synonym(s) with corresponding symbol(s).

notFound.tooltip: Not Found: The panel contains genes not recognized (and ignored during search)

gdpr.title: This site uses cookies
gdpr.cookieUsage: We use cookies to remember you came here and localStorage for your last 3 gene searches.

cookie1.purpose: Displaying help panels the first time you use this application.

Google uses this domain to off-load static content (JavaScript code, images and CSS) to a different domain name in an effort to reduce bandwidth usage and increase network performance for the end user.

gdpr.agreement: By using this application, you accept that the cookies above are stored on your computer.
gdpr.refusal: If do not accept, the cookies will be removed and you will be taken to
